reviewText: In "Heels" (2010), Kevin Richards is facing the lost of his third job in six months, and his girlfriend is threatening to kick him out.  But a night at a drag cabaret changes his life, when he first decides to prepare to enter an amateur drag contest to win a cash prize, and this awakens new possibilities for his life that he had never imagined.A simplistic though offbeat story, by writer/director Ricky Reidling (who also plays Kevin), with a well-chosen cast. It could be a learning experience for those who weren't aware how much effort goes into being a female impersonator, and the fact that not all drag queens are gay. True devotees of drag will roll their eyes at the efforts of the actors attempting the craft. who would be extremely unlikely to make a living at this in real life. Call it a mildly amusing film that is really a coming-of-age story more than about drag, per se.  DVD has trailer, commentary and outtakes.
summary: Simple but sweet story of one man's introduction to drag.

reviewText: If you like Crossdressing, you will adore this movie as I did! This is a GLBT oriented "Romantic Comedy", written in good taste, very well performed and quite entertaining/funny! I do recommend this film! Cheers!

reviewText: What a delightful story, with so much promise. Unfortunately, much of the acting was either over the top or underwhelming. Not all was lost, however -- a couple of the actors got it just right. In more experienced hands, this could have been a winner. A good rental, even if far from perfect.

reviewText: This amateur, cute story,was insightful to drag scene and relationship building.Heartfelt story of a couple who desperately needed  to split. Woman was the epitome of "bitchiness".

reviewText: Enjoyed the movie but felt they should have had a better or more experienced drag queen to pull off main role, the end performance really wouldn't have won any rewards but the over all story is good.

reviewText: This movie was recommended per genre by Amazon! Have no idea why. It is an amateurish film with bad directing, bad acting and terrible photography. The story was very predictable, but could have been fun. Avoid at all times!
